name: Caramel Slice
description: Recipe video above. An easy Caramel Slice recipe that delivers as promised - a creamy caramel filling that sets perfectly (no more runny caramel!) and chooclate that doesn't crack when you cut into it!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup  desiccated coconut ((US: sweetened finely shredded coconut, Note 1))
200g / 7oz  dark or milk melting chocolate  ((US: semi-sweet chocolate chips))

itemListElement.text: Grease and line a 28x 18cm (lamington pan) / 7" x 11" rectangle pan with baking/parchment paper (Note 2). Have overhang for ease of removal.
itemListElement.name: Grease and line a 28x 18cm (lamington pan) / 7" x 11" rectangle pan with baking/parchment paper (Note 2). Have overhang for ease of removal.

itemListElement.text: Mix together Base ingredients and press into a pan (I use an egg flip)
itemListElement.name: Mix together Base ingredients and press into a pan (I use an egg flip)

itemListElement.text: Bake for 15 minutes until the surface is golden. Cool in fridge if you have time (Note 3).
itemListElement.name: Bake for 15 minutes until the surface is golden. Cool in fridge if you have time (Note 3).

itemListElement.text: Place butter, sugar and vanilla in a saucepan over medium low heat. When the butter is melted, whisk to combine with sugar, then just leave it until it comes to a simmer.
itemListElement.name: Place butter, sugar and vanilla in a saucepan over medium low heat. When the butter is melted, whisk to combine with sugar, then just leave it until it comes to a simmer.

itemListElement.text: When bubbles appear, add condensed milk. Whisk constantly for 5 minutes (Note 4), until you start getting some big slow bubbles on the base.
itemListElement.name: When bubbles appear, add condensed milk. Whisk constantly for 5 minutes (Note 4), until you start getting some big slow bubbles on the base.

itemListElement.text: Once bubbles start appearing, whisk for 1 minute, then pour onto Base. Tilt pan to spread evenly.
itemListElement.name: Once bubbles start appearing, whisk for 1 minute, then pour onto Base. Tilt pan to spread evenly.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 12 minutes. Don't worry if you get splotchy brown bits (this happens with ovens that don't distribute heat evenly).
itemListElement.name: Bake for 12 minutes. Don't worry if you get splotchy brown bits (this happens with ovens that don't distribute heat evenly).

itemListElement.text: Cool on counter for 20 minutes then refrigerate 30 minutes - bottom of pan should be warm but surface cool (not cold) to touch. (Note 5)
itemListElement.name: Cool on counter for 20 minutes then refrigerate 30 minutes - bottom of pan should be warm but surface cool (not cold) to touch. (Note 5)

itemListElement.text: Place chocolate and oil in a microwave proof bowl. Microwave in 30 second bursts, stirring in between, until chocolate is fully melted (takes me 4 x 30 sec).
itemListElement.name: Place chocolate and oil in a microwave proof bowl. Microwave in 30 second bursts, stirring in between, until chocolate is fully melted (takes me 4 x 30 sec).

itemListElement.text: Pour over caramel, spread with spatula. Then gently shake pan to make the surface completely flat.
itemListElement.name: Pour over caramel, spread with spatula. Then gently shake pan to make the surface completely flat.

itemListElement.text: Refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Remove from fridge and leave out for 5 minutes to take chill out of chocolate slightly. Then cut into bars or squares to serve!
itemListElement.name: Refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Remove from fridge and leave out for 5 minutes to take chill out of chocolate slightly. Then cut into bars or squares to serve!

review.reviewBody: Made this as my first ever slice recipe ever.  I used Bobs Red Mill 1:1 Gluten free flour and it was a hit.  Highly recommend some sea salt flakes on top too!
My 3 kids made this on Sunday, they had fun, did not look as good as yours but they sure tasted nice and there wasn´t a crumb left :) x

sooooooooooooooooooo good
I love this so yum and easy hardly any clean up! simpliest ingreidents and method.
you can never not have any of these ingreiedents

Hi Nagi,
Thanks for another awsome recipe. Can we freeze this after its been made? Thanks =)

Nagi, you are a legend! I have made so many of your recipes and not ONE has failed to impress. My son loves caramel slice and I just made this and he said it is the best he has ever had. He is taking it to his work mates tomorrow, he is that impressed. Thank you so much for your recipes which are always a success in my kitchen x
Forgot to rate it! 5*, 10/10 recommend. Your coworkers will love you (or whomever you make these bars for!!).

I made this recipe a few months ago and have made it every week since. Everybody loves it! I use a slightly larger pan (was all I had), but like the slightly thinner layers and only use 180grams chocolate on top (no oil). I also use salted butter and it's perfect!

This recipe was absolutely perfect just like all of your recipes Nagi :)
I made this for Christmas dinner and they turned out so well. I didn't have to make any changes, the texture, the level of sweetness.... just perfection. I will be making this over and over again for sure!!
Great recipe. I didn’t have brown sugar so I put in coconut sugar in the base and half caster, half coconut in the caramel. Still turned out delicious 🤤
Great recipe. I make mine by adding 1/4 cup of cocoa to the base and I sprinkle pecans and coconut flakes on the top.
A delicious sweet treat, easy to make following Nagi’s awesome instructions. Loved by everyone.

I have made this recipe a few times now and it’s been perfect every time! It’s not too sweet and the caramel flavour is perfect!

It’s the recipe I go to when I’m looking for a easy to eat dessert that will be a crowd pleaser!
I made this slice for a bake sale once and now my friends always ask me to make it again for them.
Very easy recipe and tasty. My husband dislikes coconut completely so we substituted the same amount of coconut for almond meal. Turned out perfect and he loves it.
The salt made it perfect. Thanks!
